page.title: 07BUGTHORPE CHURCH
page.content: Although the church is not very large it does have on feature which is possibly unique. It possesses not one but two chancel arches. One of these arches is Norman in origin and the second seems to be from the Decorated Period and of the same age as the rest of the chancel. It is thought possible that alterations may have been taking place to the church when the Black Death struck before the builders had removed the original chancel arch. On the northern side of the chancel traces of an arch can still be seen both from inside and outside the church. Apparently this led to a chapel long since lost. Usually there are about fifteen people in church on Sundays at present. Only one or two children come to church. Last year there were 4 funerals 2 christenings & 1 wedding.
